conclusion: The problem involves analyzing how shadows A, B, C, and D change in position and size when the light source moves forward above the objects.
The image shows four objects (lamp, brownie, cake, cherries) casting shadows labeled A, B, C, and D on the ground.
Shadow A will shift forward as the light source moves forward above the lamp.
The size of Shadow A will decrease because the light source is moving closer to directly above the lamp, reducing the angle of illumination.
Shadow B will shift forward as the light source moves forward above the brownie.
The size of Shadow B will decrease as the light source moves closer to being directly above the brownie.
Shadow C will shift forward as the light source moves forward above the cake.
The size of Shadow C will decrease as the light source approaches a position more directly above the cake.
Shadow D will shift forward as the light source moves forward above the cherries.
The size of Shadow D will decrease as the light source moves closer to being directly above the cherries.
All shadows (A, B, C, and D) will move forward as the light source moves forward.
All shadows (A, B, C, and D) will become smaller as the light source moves closer to being directly above the objects.
When the light source moves forward, shadows A, B, C, and D will shift forward and become smaller.
